TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 685

barker_notes.barker_summary: Note On Austin's assumption of civil and military authority.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Austin's autograph, written on back of copy of Bastrop's proclamation of August 5, 1823.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 685

div1.p: Note On Austin's assumption of civil and military authority.

And the civil and militia officers and Inhabitants having in due form acknowledged and recognized the said Austin as invested with the faculties and powers conferred on him by the Superior Govt. he the said Austin entered upon the Civil and military command of the Colony on the 10 of August 1823, 3 year of Independance and 2 of Liberty
